item.title: 特朗普称正在审查雪佛龙委内瑞拉石油出口项目
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，雪佛龙公司继续从委内瑞拉出口原油的能力正在接受审查，这表明美国愿意对这家石油巨头在南美国家的业务实施更严格的限制。【原文：Chevron Corp.’s ability to continue exporting crude from Venezuela is under review, President Donald Trump said, signaling an openness to tighter restraints on the oil giant’s operations in the South American country.】

item.title: 一个小岛国出售护照以应对气候变化
item.description:
为重新安置受洪水威胁的瑙鲁约 1 万人所做的努力表明，全球适应资金缺口估计每年高达 3590 亿美元。【原文：

Efforts to relocate about 10,000 people on flooding-threatened Nauru illustrate a gap in global adaptation funding estimated at as much as $359 billion a year. 

】

item.title: 野火如何颠覆加州保险市场
item.description: 1 月份席卷洛杉矶的大火将对该州本已压力重重的保险市场产生深远而持久的影响。【原文：The fires that swept through Los Angeles in January will have deep and long-lasting effects on the state’s already stressed insurance market.】

item.title: 布鲁克林出租大楼将在可持续发展方面创下新纪录
item.description: 纽约一家开发商公布了在布鲁克林市中心建造一座公寓楼的计划，该公寓楼将远远超过城市和州的能效标准，并将成为世界上最高的同类建筑。【原文：A New York developer is unveiling plans for an apartment tower in downtown Brooklyn that will far exceed city and state energy-efficiency standards and be the tallest building of its kind in the world.】

item.title: 污水泄漏、账单增加— 英国水危机解析
item.description: 在系统性污水泄漏和管道长期漏水丑闻的影响下，英国自来水行业正准备进行自 1989 年私有化以来最大规模的改革。经过数十年的投资不足，用户将通过有史以来最大的家庭和企业账单涨幅来承担解决问题的成本。【原文：Britain’s water industry is bracing for the biggest overhaul since privatization in 1989 amid a scandal over systematic sewage spills and chronic pipe leaks. After decades of underinvestment, it’s customers who will shoulder the cost of fixing the problems through the biggest ever bill increase for households and business.】

item.title: 北极空气冻结欧洲，但温暖天气即将到来
item.description: 一股北极气流给欧洲部分地区带来了短暂的寒冷，柏林创下了今冬的最低气温，但温暖的天气即将到来。【原文：A blast of arctic air is bringing a brief frigid snap to parts of Europe, with Berlin recording its lowest temperatures this winter, but warmer weather is on its way.】

item.title: 东盟国家需要超级电网来实现气候目标
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将介绍东南亚地区期待已久的超级电网项目的进展情况。该项目被视为该地区清洁能源转型的关键。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at progress on a long-vaunted supergrid across Southeast Asia. The project is seen as essential for the region’s clean energy transition.】

item.title: DeepSeek 正在为中国气象局的预报提供支持
item.description: 中国国家气象局正在考虑使用 DeepSeek（一家本地初创公司，其人工智能模型上个月震动了全球市场）来支持其预报和观测工作。【原文：China’s state weather agency is considering using DeepSeek, the local startup whose artificial intelligence model shook global markets last month, to power its forecasts and observations.】

item.title: 日本设定 2035 年减排目标 被视为未达到全球目标
item.description: 根据修订后的气候目标，日本将力争在 2035 年之前将温室气体排放量从 2013 年的水平减少 60%，这一政策被认为没有达到实现《巴黎协定》目标所需的行动。【原文：Japan will aim to cut greenhouse gas emissions 60% by 2035 from 2013 levels under a revised climate target, a policy seen as falling short of action required to meet Paris Agreement goals.】

item.title: 前 Pimco 高管运营全球首只巨灾债券 ETF
item.description: 近年来，巨灾债券的回报率一直高于高收益债务市场，现在即将有更多的投资者可以购买巨灾债券。【原文：Catastrophe bonds, whose returns have consistently trounced those of high-yield debt markets in recent years, are about to become accessible to a wider group of investors.】

item.title: 玛氏携手恒天然减少新西兰农场排放
item.description: 糖果巨头玛氏公司（Mars Inc.【原文：Candy giant Mars Inc. is partnering with the world’s biggest dairy exporter to help reduce greenhouse gas emissions on New Zealand farms.】

item.title: 全球变暖可能使欧洲风力减弱
item.description: 最新研究表明，全球变暖导致欧洲夏季风速下降，气温飙升增加了制冷需求，给该地区的能源系统带来了额外压力。【原文：Global warming is driving down wind speeds during European summers, putting additional stress on the region’s energy systems as soaring temperatures boost cooling demand, new research shows.】

item.title: 德国将缩减气候雄心
item.description: 两年前，德国最大的钢铁制造商蒂森克虏伯公司（Thyssenkrupp AG）获得了 20 亿欧元（21 亿美元）的补贴，用于支付氢气炉的费用。这是有史以来最大的同类承诺，也是德国计划向清洁燃料过渡的一个高潮。然而，燃烧氢气的计划现已搁浅。自去年年底政府垮台以来，主要能源转型项目的资金已被冻结，主要政党已明确表示，他们的优先事项不在这里。【原文：Two years ago, Thyssenkrupp AG, the nation’s biggest steelmaker, was awarded €2 billion ($2.1 billion) in subsidies to help pay for a hydrogen furnace. It was the biggest-ever commitment of its kind, and a high point in Germany’s planned transition to clean fuel. Yet plans to burn hydrogen are now on hold. Since the government collapsed late last year, funding for key energy transition programs have been frozen, and the leading political parties have made clear that their priorities lie elsewher】

item.title: 航运巨头敦促监管机构在推进清洁工作时避免使用生物燃料
item.description: 包括赫伯罗特公司（Hapag-Lloyd AG）和路易达孚公司（Louis Dreyfus Co.）海运部门在内的一些航运公司呼吁国际海事组织，在航运业推动去碳化的过程中，不要支持以农作物为原料的生物燃料。【原文：Some shipping lines including Hapag-Lloyd AG and the maritime arm of Louis Dreyfus Co. are calling on the International Maritime Organization to avoid backing crop-based biofuels as the industry pushes to decarbonize.】

item.title: 地震中心称新德里发生 4.0 级地震
item.description: 当地时间凌晨 5:36 左右，印度首都新德里发生 4.0 级地震。【原文：India’s capital New Delhi was struck by a 4.0 magnitude earthquake around 5:36am local time.】

item.title: 英国自 20 世纪 70 年代以来的首个新核电站开始发放许可证
item.description: 自上世纪 70 年代以来，英国首个商业核电站新址正在接受该国监管机构的许可，而此时政府正在简化新项目的审批程序。【原文：The UK’s first new location for a commercial nuclear power plant since the 1970s is undergoing licensing from the country’s regulator, at a time when the government is making it easier to approve new projects.】

item.title: 冬季风暴导致肯塔基州断电并引发洪水
item.description: 一场巨大的冬季风暴给肯塔基州和田纳西州带来了毁灭性的洪灾，全美数百架航班停飞，南方 50 多万用户断电。【原文：A huge winter storm brought devastating flooding to Kentucky and Tennessee, grounded hundreds of flights across the US and knocked out power to more than half a million customers in the South.】

item.title: 澳大利亚铁矿石枢纽重新开放，里约矿山在飓风后恢复开采
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的铁矿石港口重新开放，力拓公司的矿山在热带气旋 "泽利亚 "的袭击中幸免于难，恢复运营。【原文：Australia’s biggest iron ore port reopened and Rio Tinto Plc mines resumed operations after being spared any major damage from Tropical Cyclone Zelia.】

item.title: 特朗普终止应对灾害机构内部的气候工作
item.description:
一份发给美国国土安全部领导层的备忘录命令取消与气候有关的活动。【原文：

A memo sent to leadership at the US Department of Homeland Security orders the elimination of climate-related activities.

】

item.title: 天气预报员称本周英国将重现阳光
item.description: 英国气象局表示，在英国大部分地区经历了上周的持续阴霾之后，阳光即将回归。【原文：Sunshine is set to return after much of the UK experienced persistent gloom over the last week, the Met Office said.】

item.title: 从纽约市到多伦多，混乱的冬季风暴将带来降雪和降雨
item.description: 纽约和美国东北部地区将在周六夜间迎来一场冬季暴风雪，这场暴风雪还将覆盖中西部和安大略省南部地区，降雪量将达到几英寸。【原文：New York and the US Northeast will pick up a few inches of snow overnight on Saturday from a winter storm that will also blanket the Midwest and southern Ontario.】

item.title: 特朗普就禁止汽油车问题向加州施压
item.description: 特朗普政府正在对加州汽车污染法规进行初步打击，迫使零排放汽车销售，总统称这些法规扼杀了消费者的选择权。【原文：The Trump administration is delivering an initial strike against California car pollution regulations compelling zero-emission vehicle sales that the president says are strangling consumer choice.】

item.title: 飓风减弱后澳大利亚铁矿石出口枢纽将重新开放
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的铁矿石港口预计将在周六晚些时候重新开放，因为它没有受到强烈热带气旋 "泽利亚 "的严重破坏。【原文：Australia’s biggest iron ore port is expected to reopen later Saturday after being spared any major damage from Severe Tropical Cyclone Zelia.】

item.title: 美国政府大清洗：环保局解雇近 400 名员工
item.description: 环境保护局周五表示，它已解雇了 388 名员工，这是本周在埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 "政府效率部"（Department of Government Efficiency）推动下联邦政府解雇员工浪潮的一部分。【原文：The Environmental Protection Agency said Friday it had fired 388 workers, part of a wave of terminations across the federal government this week spurred by Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency.】

item.title: 达菲称得克萨斯州石油出口港将获得特朗普团队的支持
item.description: 美国交通部长肖恩-达菲（Sean Duffy）表示，特朗普政府计划 "推进 "对 Sentinel Midstream LLC 提议在得克萨斯州建设的一个每天可装运 100 万桶石油的港口的审批。【原文：Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said the Trump administration planned to “move forward” with approval of a Texas port capable of shipping 1 million barrels of oil a day proposed by Sentinel Midstream LLC.】

item.title: 特朗普将成立白宫委员会推动能源主导地位
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五将签署一项命令，成立 "国家能源主导委员会"，负责指导美国在这一问题上的政策，强调他致力于推动已经创下纪录的国内石油和天然气生产。【原文：President Donald Trump on Friday is slated to sign an order creating a “national energy dominance council,” and will task it with steering US policy on the issue, underscoring his commitment to driving already record-setting domestic oil and gas production.】

item.title: 特朗普解除拜登的禁令后将批准天然气出口项目
item.description: 据一位高级政府官员透露，特朗普政府准备首次批准液化天然气出口项目，以兑现其释放燃料运输洪流的承诺。【原文：The Trump administration is poised to grant its first approval for a project to export liquefied natural gas as the administration seeks to make good on a pledge to unleash a torrent of fuel shipments, according to a senior administration official.】

item.title: 石油巨头准备重启战略，英国石油公司投资者欢迎埃利奥特
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）的几位股东表示，他们欢迎激进分子埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）入股这家英国石油巨头，因为该公司需要进行有意义的变革。【原文：Several BP Plc shareholders said they welcome activist Elliott Investment Management taking a stake in the British oil major because the company needs to make meaningful changes.】

item.title: 下周从芝加哥到纽约的寒流将袭击美国
item.description: 下周，随着北极寒流从加拿大南下，一股横跨美国中西部的冷空气将袭击美国东部地区，给电网带来考验，并使取暖燃料需求急剧上升。【原文：A burst of frigid air across the Midwest will pummel the US East next week, testing power grids and sending heating-fuel demand sharply higher as arctic cold pushes south from Canada.】

item.title: 可持续 "投资者逃离气候变化话题
item.description:
共和党对 ESG 的成功攻击以及唐纳德-特朗普的再次当选让所有人都在四处躲藏。【原文：

The success of Republican attacks on ESG and Donald Trump’s re-election has everyone running for cover.

】
